CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. You MUST use the search tool to find information before answering
2. Do NOT describe what you would search for - actually CALL the tool
3. Use the search results to provide accurate answers
4. Always include references by citing the filename
5. Format references as: [FILENAME](https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation/blob/main/FILENAME)

response:
Based on the documentation in README.md, here are the ways to run the project locally:

**1. Local Deployment with Docker:**

```bash
# Build the Docker image
docker build -t workout-recommendation .

# Run the container
docker run -p 5000:5000 workout-recommendation

# Access the application
open http://localhost:5000
```

[README.md](https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation/blob/main/README.md)

**2. Local Setup with Virtual Environment:**

First, clone the repository and create/activate a virtual environment as follows:

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation.git
cd workout-recommendation

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate virtual environment
# Windows:
venv\\Scripts\\activate
# macOS/Linux:
source venv/bin/activate
```

Then, you can train the model and run the project.

[README.md](https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation/blob/main/README.md)

content.content:
### Local Deployment with Docker

```bash
# Build the Docker image
docker build -t workout-recommendation .

# Run the container
docker run -p 5000:5000 workout-recommendation

# Access the application
open http://localhost:5000
```

### Cloud Deployment (Railway)

The application is deployed on Railway and accessible at:

**🌐 Live URL**: `https://workout-recommendation-production.up.railway.app/`

### Prerequisites

- Python 3.9+
- pip
- Docker (optional, for containerization)

### Option 1: Local Setup with Virtual Environment

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation.git
cd workout-recommendation

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate virtual environment
# Windows:
venv\Scripts\activate
# macOS/Linux:
source v

### 1. Data Exploration (Optional)

```bash
# Open Jupyter notebook
jupyter notebook notebook.ipynb
```

The notebook contains:
- Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
- Feature engineering
- Model training and evaluation
- Visualizations

### 2. Train the Model

```bash
# Train the model
python train.py
```

This will:
- Load preprocessed data
- Train XGBoost classifier
- Evaluate on test set
- Save mo

```
workout-recommendation/
│
├── data/
│   └── gym_members_exercise_tracking.csv    # Raw dataset
│
├── models/
│   ├── data_prepared.pkl                    # Preprocessed data (train/val/test splits, scaler)
│   ├── best_model.pkl                       # Best model from notebook
│   └── final_model.pkl                      # Final trained model (used by predict.py)
│
├── notebook.ipynb

parts.content:
Based on the documentation in README.md, here are the ways to run the project locally:

**1. Local Deployment with Docker:**

```bash
# Build the Docker image
docker build -t workout-recommendation .

# Run the container
docker run -p 5000:5000 workout-recommendation

# Access the application
open http://localhost:5000
```

[README.md](https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation/blob/main/README.md)

**2. Local Setup with Virtual Environment:**

First, clone the repository and create/activate a virtual environment as follows:

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation.git
cd workout-recommendation

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate virtual environment
# Windows:
venv\\Scripts\\activate
# macOS/Linux:
source venv/bin/activate
```

Then, you can train the model and run the project.

[README.md](https://github.com/ilhamksyuriadi/workout-recommendation/blob/main/README.md)
